Class ec.ifc.app.ECSimpleCGItem 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.ContainerView
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECControlGroupItem
                           |
                           +----ec.ifc.app.ECSimpleCGItem
public class ECSimpleCGItem
extends ECControlGroupItem
This is the most general ECControlGroupItem subclass. It combines a textfield displaying the label with one other subview, called the 'control'. The control is typically a textfield or popup menu, but can be any View. The width of the control can be automatically sized or be set to a fixed size. The height of the label field and control are determined from the height of the ECSimpleCGItem and the adjustable contentsMargin().

You can subclass from ECSimpleCGItem to add additional subviews.

DEFAULT_CONTROL_FIXED_WIDTH
DEFAULT_CONTROL_HORIZ_MARGIN
DEFAULT_CONTROL_VERT_MARGIN
lastLabelWidth
the label width we were most recently told to adjust to
myControl
the subview that the label is a label for
myControlFixedWidth
the width of the control if it's fixed
myControlHorizMargin
the space between the right edge of the label and the control
myControlResizesAutomatically
whether or not the control's width is determined automatically
myControlVertMargin
the space above and below the control
myLabelField
the text field displaying the label

ECSimpleCGItem()
Returns a new ECSimpleCGItem with no control, label field, or label, and a height of 0.
ECSimpleCGItem(View, TextField, String, int)
Returns a new ECSimpleCGItem with the specified control, label field, label, and height.

controlResizesAutomatically()
Returns whether positionControl() determines the width of the control automatically.
getControl()
Returns the subview that the label is a label for, typically a text field, popup menu, or other such simple control.
getControlFixedWidth()
Returns the control's fixed with, which is used by positionControl() when controlResizesAutomatically returns false.
getControlHorizMargin()
Returns the amount of space that layoutContents() provides between the right edge of the label and the left edge of the control
getControlVertMargin()
Returns the amount of space that layoutContents() provides above and below the control.
getLabel()
Returns the text label that is optionally shown as part of this item.
getLabelField()
Returns the text field displaying the label.
layoutContents(int)
Called by ECControlGroup when the width or other conditions of this item change in such a way that this item needs to be laid out again.
positionControl(int)
Sets the position of the control based on the specified label width.
positionLabelField(int)
Sets the position of the label field based on the specified label width, and sets the justification to Graphics.RIGHT_JUSTIFIED.
relayoutContents()
Positions the subviews appropriately, using most recent label width that was passed to layoutContents.
setControl(View)
Sets the control subview.
setControlFixedWidth(int)
Sets the control's fixed width
setControlHorizMargin(int)
Sets the control horizontal margin, and repositions the control.
setControlResizesAutomatically(boolean)
Sets whether the control resizes automatically.
setControlVertMargin(int)
Sets the control vertical margin, and repositions the control.
setLabel(String)
Sets the text label that is optionally shown as part of this item.
setLabelField(TextField)
Sets the text field displaying the label.

ECSimpleCGItem 
  public ECSimpleCGItem()
Returns a new ECSimpleCGItem with no control, label field, or label, and a height of 0. You can change the height of an ECControlGroup item before adding it to an ECControlGroup, but not afterwards.
ECSimpleCGItem 
  public ECSimpleCGItem(View control,
                        TextField labelField,
                        String label,
                        int height)
Returns a new ECSimpleCGItem with the specified control, label field, label, and height. The control resizes automatically.
See Also:
setControlResizesAutomatically

controlResizesAutomatically 
  public boolean controlResizesAutomatically()
Returns whether positionControl() determines the width of the control automatically. If this is false, positionControl() uses the result of getControlFixedWidth().
getControl 
  public View getControl()
Returns the subview that the label is a label for, typically a text field, popup menu, or other such simple control.
getControlFixedWidth 
  public int getControlFixedWidth()
Returns the control's fixed with, which is used by positionControl() when controlResizesAutomatically returns false.
See Also:
controlResizesAutomatically
getControlHorizMargin 
  public int getControlHorizMargin()
Returns the amount of space that layoutContents() provides between the right edge of the label and the left edge of the control
getControlVertMargin 
  public int getControlVertMargin()
Returns the amount of space that layoutContents() provides above and below the control.
getLabel 
  public String getLabel()
Returns the text label that is optionally shown as part of this item.
Overrides:
getLabel in class ECControlGroupItem
getLabelField 
  public TextField getLabelField()
Returns the text field displaying the label. Creates a new one if there is none currently.
layoutContents 
  public void layoutContents(int labelWidth)
Called by ECControlGroup when the width or other conditions of this item change in such a way that this item needs to be laid out again. labelWidth specifies how much horizontal space should be reserved for the label (if any). Subclasses should override after calling super() to reposition additional subviews appropriately. To change the positioning of the label field or control, subclasses should override positionLabelField and/or positionControl instead.
Overrides:
layoutContents in class ECControlGroupItem
relayoutContents 
  public void relayoutContents()
Positions the subviews appropriately, using most recent label width that was passed to layoutContents. Call when the contents of this item have changed (not when the control group as a whole has changed)
setControl 
  public void setControl(View newControl)
Sets the control subview.
See Also:
getControl
setControlFixedWidth 
  public void setControlFixedWidth(int newValue)
Sets the control's fixed width
See Also:
getControlFixedWidth
setControlHorizMargin 
  public void setControlHorizMargin(int newMargin)
Sets the control horizontal margin, and repositions the control. Values less than zero are converted to zero.
See Also:
getControlHorizMargin
setControlResizesAutomatically 
  public void setControlResizesAutomatically(boolean newValue)
Sets whether the control resizes automatically.
See Also:
controlResizesAutomatically
setControlVertMargin 
  public void setControlVertMargin(int newMargin)
Sets the control vertical margin, and repositions the control. Values less than zero are converted to zero.
See Also:
getControlVertMargin
setLabel 
  public void setLabel(String newLabel)
Sets the text label that is optionally shown as part of this item. If the label has embedded "\n"s, it will be split onto multiple lines.
Overrides:
setLabel in class ECControlGroupItem
setLabelField 
  public void setLabelField(TextField newField)
Sets the text field displaying the label. Call this if you want the text field to be a TextField subclass.
positionControl 
  protected void positionControl(int labelWidth)
Sets the position of the control based on the specified label width. Called from layoutContents. Override if you want to position the control differently.
positionLabelField 
  protected void positionLabelField(int labelWidth)
Sets the position of the label field based on the specified label width, and sets the justification to Graphics.RIGHT_JUSTIFIED. Called from layoutContents. Override if you want to position the label field differently, or use a different justification.
